intro: Uragoga trichotoma, commonly known as the hairy uragoga, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Uragoga trichotoma is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
